verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:1
verses.text: After the death of Saul, David returned from defeating the Amalekites and stayed in Ziklag two days.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:2
verses.text: On the third day a man arrived from Saul's camp, with his clothes torn and with dust on his head. When he came to David, he fell to the ground to pay him honor.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:3
verses.text: "Where have you come from?" David asked him. He answered, "I have escaped from the Israelite camp."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:4
verses.text: "What happened?" David asked. "Tell me." He said, "The men fled from the battle. Many of them fell and died. And Saul and his son Jonathan are dead."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:5
verses.text: Then David said to the young man who brought him the report, "How do you know that Saul and his son Jonathan are dead?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:6
verses.text: "I happened to be on Mount Gilboa," the young man said, "and there was Saul, leaning on his spear, with the chariots and riders almost upon him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:7
verses.text: When he turned around and saw me, he called out to me, and I said, 'What can I do?'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:8
verses.text: "He asked me, 'Who are you?'"'An Amalekite,' I answered.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:9
verses.text: "Then he said to me, 'Stand over me and kill me! I am in the throes of death, but I'm still alive.'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:10
verses.text: "So I stood over him and killed him, because I knew that after he had fallen he could not survive. And I took the crown that was on his head and the band on his arm and have brought them here to my lord."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:11
verses.text: Then David and all the men with him took hold of their clothes and tore them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:12
verses.text: They mourned and wept and fasted till evening for Saul and his son Jonathan, and for the army of the LORD and the house of Israel, because they had fallen by the sword.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:13
verses.text: David said to the young man who brought him the report, "Where are you from?I am the son of an alien, an Amalekite," he answered.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:14
verses.text: David asked him, "Why were you not afraid to lift your hand to destroy the LORD's anointed?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:15
verses.text: Then David called one of his men and said, "Go, strike him down!" So he struck him down, and he died.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:16
verses.text: For David had said to him, "Your blood be on your own head. Your own mouth testified against you when you said, 'I killed the LORD's anointed.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:17
verses.text: David took up this lament concerning Saul and his son Jonathan,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:18
verses.text: and ordered that the men of Judah be taught this lament of the bow (it is written in the Book of Jashar):

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:19
verses.text: "Your glory, O Israel, lies slain on your heights. How the mighty have fallen!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:20
verses.text: "Tell it not in Gath, proclaim it not in the streets of Ashkelon, lest the daughters of the Philistines be glad, lest the daughters of the uncircumcised rejoice.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:21
verses.text: "O mountains of Gilboa, may you have neither dew nor rain, nor fields that yield offerings of grain. For there the shield of the mighty was defiled, the shield of Saul-no longer rubbed with oil.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:22
verses.text: From the blood of the slain, from the flesh of the mighty, the bow of Jonathan did not turn back, the sword of Saul did not return unsatisfied.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:23
verses.text: "Saul and Jonathan- in life they were loved and gracious, and in death they were not parted. They were swifter than eagles, they were stronger than lions.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:24
verses.text: "O daughters of Israel, weep for Saul, who clothed you in scarlet and finery, who adorned your garments with ornaments of gold.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:25
verses.text: "How the mighty have fallen in battle! Jonathan lies slain on your heights.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:26
verses.text: I grieve for you, Jonathan my brother; you were very dear to me. Your love for me was wonderful, more wonderful than that of women.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 1:27
verses.text: "How the mighty have fallen! The weapons of war have perished!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:1
verses.text: In the course of time, David inquired of the LORD. "Shall I go up to one of the towns of Judah?" he asked. The LORD said, "Go up." David asked, "Where shall I go?To Hebron," the LORD answered.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:2
verses.text: So David went up there with his two wives, Ahinoam of Jezreel and Abigail, the widow of Nabal of Carmel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:3
verses.text: David also took the men who were with him, each with his family, and they settled in Hebron and its towns.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:4
verses.text: Then the men of Judah came to Hebron and there they anointed David king over the house of Judah. When David was told that it was the men of Jabesh Gilead who had buried Saul,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:5
verses.text: he sent messengers to the men of Jabesh Gilead to say to them, "The LORD bless you for showing this kindness to Saul your master by burying him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:6
verses.text: May the LORD now show you kindness and faithfulness, and I too will show you the same favor because you have done this.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:7
verses.text: Now then, be strong and brave, for Saul your master is dead, and the house of Judah has anointed me king over them."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:8
verses.text: Meanwhile, Abner son of Ner, the commander of Saul's army, had taken Ish-Bosheth son of Saul and brought him over to Mahanaim.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:9
verses.text: He made him king over Gilead, Ashuri and Jezreel, and also over Ephraim, Benjamin and all Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:10
verses.text: Ish-Bosheth son of Saul was forty years old when he became king over Israel, and he reigned two years. The house of Judah, however, followed David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:11
verses.text: The length of time David was king in Hebron over the house of Judah was seven years and six months.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:12
verses.text: Abner son of Ner, together with the men of Ish-Bosheth son of Saul, left Mahanaim and went to Gibeon.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:13
verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah and David's men went out and met them at the pool of Gibeon. One group sat down on one side of the pool and one group on the other side.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:14
verses.text: Then Abner said to Joab, "Let's have some of the young men get up and fight hand to hand in front of us.All right, let them do it," Joab said.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:15
verses.text: So they stood up and were counted off-twelve men for Benjamin and Ish-Bosheth son of Saul, and twelve for David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:16
verses.text: Then each man grabbed his opponent by the head and thrust his dagger into his opponent's side, and they fell down together. So that place in Gibeon was called Helkath Hazzurim.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:17
verses.text: The battle that day was very fierce, and Abner and the men of Israel were defeated by David's men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:18
verses.text: The three sons of Zeruiah were there: Joab, Abishai and Asahel. Now Asahel was as fleet-footed as a wild gazelle.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:19
verses.text: He chased Abner, turning neither to the right nor to the left as he pursued him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:20
verses.text: Abner looked behind him and asked, "Is that you, Asahel?It is," he answered.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:21
verses.text: Then Abner said to him, "Turn aside to the right or to the left; take on one of the young men and strip him of his weapons." But Asahel would not stop chasing him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:22
verses.text: Again Abner warned Asahel, "Stop chasing me! Why should I strike you down? How could I look your brother Joab in the face?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:23
verses.text: But Asahel refused to give up the pursuit; so Abner thrust the butt of his spear into Asahel's stomach, and the spear came out through his back. He fell there and died on the spot. And every man stopped when he came to the place where Asahel had fallen and died.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:24
verses.text: But Joab and Abishai pursued Abner, and as the sun was setting, they came to the hill of Ammah, near Giah on the way to the wasteland of Gibeon.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:25
verses.text: Then the men of Benjamin rallied behind Abner. They formed themselves into a group and took their stand on top of a hill.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:26
verses.text: Abner called out to Joab, "Must the sword devour forever? Don't you realize that this will end in bitterness? How long before you order your men to stop pursuing their brothers?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:27
verses.text: Joab answered, "As surely as God lives, if you had not spoken, the men would have continued the pursuit of their brothers until morning. "

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:28
verses.text: So Joab blew the trumpet, and all the men came to a halt; they no longer pursued Israel, nor did they fight anymore.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:29
verses.text: All that night Abner and his men marched through the Arabah. They crossed the Jordan, continued through the whole Bithron and came to Mahanaim.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:30
verses.text: Then Joab returned from pursuing Abner and assembled all his men. Besides Asahel, nineteen of David's men were found missing.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:31
verses.text: But David's men had killed three hundred and sixty Benjamites who were with Abner.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 2:32
verses.text: They took Asahel and buried him in his father's tomb at Bethlehem. Then Joab and his men marched all night and arrived at Hebron by daybreak.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:1
verses.text: The war between the house of Saul and the house of David lasted a long time. David grew stronger and stronger, while the house of Saul grew weaker and weaker.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:2
verses.text: Sons were born to David in Hebron: His firstborn was Amnon the son of Ahinoam of Jezreel;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:3
verses.text: his second, Kileab the son of Abigail the widow of Nabal of Carmel; the third, Absalom the son of Maacah daughter of Talmai king of Geshur;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:4
verses.text: the fourth, Adonijah the son of Haggith; the fifth, Shephatiah the son of Abital;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:5
verses.text: and the sixth, Ithream the son of David's wife Eglah. These were born to David in Hebron.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:6
verses.text: During the war between the house of Saul and the house of David, Abner had been strengthening his own position in the house of Saul.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:7
verses.text: Now Saul had had a concubine named Rizpah daughter of Aiah. And Ish-Bosheth said to Abner, "Why did you sleep with my father's concubine?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:8
verses.text: Abner was very angry because of what Ish-Bosheth said and he answered, "Am I a dog's head-on Judah's side? This very day I am loyal to the house of your father Saul and to his family and friends. I haven't handed you over to David. Yet now you accuse me of an offense involving this woman!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:9
verses.text: May God deal with Abner, be it ever so severely, if I do not do for David what the LORD promised him on oath

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:10
verses.text: and transfer the kingdom from the house of Saul and establish David's throne over Israel and Judah from Dan to Beersheba."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:11
verses.text: Ish-Bosheth did not dare to say another word to Abner, because he was afraid of him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:12
verses.text: Then Abner sent messengers on his behalf to say to David, "Whose land is it? Make an agreement with me, and I will help you bring all Israel over to you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:13
verses.text: "Good," said David. "I will make an agreement with you. But I demand one thing of you: Do not come into my presence unless you bring Michal daughter of Saul when you come to see me."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:14
verses.text: Then David sent messengers to Ish-Bosheth son of Saul, demanding, "Give me my wife Michal, whom I betrothed to myself for the price of a hundred Philistine foreskins."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:15
verses.text: So Ish-Bosheth gave orders and had her taken away from her husband Paltiel son of Laish.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:16
verses.text: Her husband, however, went with her, weeping behind her all the way to Bahurim. Then Abner said to him, "Go back home!" So he went back.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:17
verses.text: Abner conferred with the elders of Israel and said, "For some time you have wanted to make David your king.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:18
verses.text: Now do it! For the LORD promised David, 'By my servant David I will rescue my people Israel from the hand of the Philistines and from the hand of all their enemies.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:19
verses.text: Abner also spoke to the Benjamites in person. Then he went to Hebron to tell David everything that Israel and the whole house of Benjamin wanted to do.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:20
verses.text: When Abner, who had twenty men with him, came to David at Hebron, David prepared a feast for him and his men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:21
verses.text: Then Abner said to David, "Let me go at once and assemble all Israel for my lord the king, so that they may make a compact with you, and that you may rule over all that your heart desires." So David sent Abner away, and he went in peace.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:22
verses.text: Just then David's men and Joab returned from a raid and brought with them a great deal of plunder. But Abner was no longer with David in Hebron, because David had sent him away, and he had gone in peace.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:23
verses.text: When Joab and all the soldiers with him arrived, he was told that Abner son of Ner had come to the king and that the king had sent him away and that he had gone in peace.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:24
verses.text: So Joab went to the king and said, "What have you done? Look, Abner came to you. Why did you let him go? Now he is gone!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:25
verses.text: You know Abner son of Ner; he came to deceive you and observe your movements and find out everything you are doing."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:26
verses.text: Joab then left David and sent messengers after Abner, and they brought him back from the well of Sirah. But David did not know it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:27
verses.text: Now when Abner returned to Hebron, Joab took him aside into the gateway, as though to speak with him privately. And there, to avenge the blood of his brother Asahel, Joab stabbed him in the stomach, and he died.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:28
verses.text: Later, when David heard about this, he said, "I and my kingdom are forever innocent before the LORD concerning the blood of Abner son of Ner.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:29
verses.text: May his blood fall upon the head of Joab and upon all his father's house! May Joab's house never be without someone who has a running sore or leprosy or who leans on a crutch or who falls by the sword or who lacks food."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:30
verses.text: (Joab and his brother Abishai murdered Abner because he had killed their brother Asahel in the battle at Gibeon.)

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:31
verses.text: Then David said to Joab and all the people with him, "Tear your clothes and put on sackcloth and walk in mourning in front of Abner." King David himself walked behind the bier.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:32
verses.text: They buried Abner in Hebron, and the king wept aloud at Abner's tomb. All the people wept also.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:33
verses.text: The king sang this lament for Abner: "Should Abner have died as the lawless die?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:34
verses.text: Your hands were not bound, your feet were not fettered. You fell as one falls before wicked men." And all the people wept over him again.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:35
verses.text: Then they all came and urged David to eat something while it was still day; but David took an oath, saying, "May God deal with me, be it ever so severely, if I taste bread or anything else before the sun sets!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:36
verses.text: All the people took note and were pleased; indeed, everything the king did pleased them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:37
verses.text: So on that day all the people and all Israel knew that the king had no part in the murder of Abner son of Ner.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:38
verses.text: Then the king said to his men, "Do you not realize that a prince and a great man has fallen in Israel this day?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 3:39
verses.text: And today, though I am the anointed king, I am weak, and these sons of Zeruiah are too strong for me. May the LORD repay the evildoer according to his evil deeds!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:1
verses.text: When Ish-Bosheth son of Saul heard that Abner had died in Hebron, he lost courage, and all Israel became alarmed.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:2
verses.text: Now Saul's son had two men who were leaders of raiding bands. One was named Baanah and the other Recab; they were sons of Rimmon the Beerothite from the tribe of Benjamin-Beeroth is considered part of Benjamin,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:3
verses.text: because the people of Beeroth fled to Gittaim and have lived there as aliens to this day.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:4
verses.text: (Jonathan son of Saul had a son who was lame in both feet. He was five years old when the news about Saul and Jonathan came from Jezreel. His nurse picked him up and fled, but as she hurried to leave, he fell and became crippled. His name was Mephibosheth.)

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:5
verses.text: Now Recab and Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, set out for the house of Ish-Bosheth, and they arrived there in the heat of the day while he was taking his noonday rest.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:6
verses.text: They went into the inner part of the house as if to get some wheat, and they stabbed him in the stomach. Then Recab and his brother Baanah slipped away.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:7
verses.text: They had gone into the house while he was lying on the bed in his bedroom. After they stabbed and killed him, they cut off his head. Taking it with them, they traveled all night by way of the Arabah.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:8
verses.text: They brought the head of Ish-Bosheth to David at Hebron and said to the king, "Here is the head of Ish-Bosheth son of Saul, your enemy, who tried to take your life. This day the LORD has avenged my lord the king against Saul and his offspring."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:9
verses.text: David answered Recab and his brother Baanah, the sons of Rimmon the Beerothite, "As surely as the LORD lives, who has delivered me out of all trouble,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:10
verses.text: when a man told me, 'Saul is dead,' and thought he was bringing good news, I seized him and put him to death in Ziklag. That was the reward I gave him for his news!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:11
verses.text: How much more-when wicked men have killed an innocent man in his own house and on his own bed-should I not now demand his blood from your hand and rid the earth of you!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 4:12
verses.text: So David gave an order to his men, and they killed them. They cut off their hands and feet and hung the bodies by the pool in Hebron. But they took the head of Ish-Bosheth and buried it in Abner's tomb at Hebron.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:1
verses.text: All the tribes of Israel came to David at Hebron and said, "We are your own flesh and blood.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:2
verses.text: In the past, while Saul was king over us, you were the one who led Israel on their military campaigns. And the LORD said to you, 'You will shepherd my people Israel, and you will become their ruler.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:3
verses.text: When all the elders of Israel had come to King David at Hebron, the king made a compact with them at Hebron before the LORD, and they anointed David king over Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:4
verses.text: David was thirty years old when he became king, and he reigned forty years.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:5
verses.text: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months, and in Jerusalem he reigned over all Israel and Judah thirty-three years.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:6
verses.text: The king and his men marched to Jerusalem to attack the Jebusites, who lived there. The Jebusites said to David, "You will not get in here; even the blind and the lame can ward you off." They thought, "David cannot get in here."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:7
verses.text: Nevertheless, David captured the fortress of Zion, the City of David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:8
verses.text: On that day, David said, "Anyone who conquers the Jebusites will have to use the water shaft to reach those 'lame and blind' who are David's enemies. "That is why they say, "The 'blind and lame' will not enter the palace."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:9
verses.text: David then took up residence in the fortress and called it the City of David. He built up the area around it, from the supporting terraces inward.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:10
verses.text: And he became more and more powerful, because the LORD God Almighty was with him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:11
verses.text: Now Hiram king of Tyre sent messengers to David, along with cedar logs and carpenters and stonemasons, and they built a palace for David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:12
verses.text: And David knew that the LORD had established him as king over Israel and had exalted his kingdom for the sake of his people Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:13
verses.text: After he left Hebron, David took more concubines and wives in Jerusalem, and more sons and daughters were born to him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:14
verses.text: These are the names of the children born to him there: Shammua, Shobab, Nathan, Solomon,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:15
verses.text: Ibhar, Elishua, Nepheg, Japhia,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:16
verses.text: Elishama, Eliada and Eliphelet.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:17
verses.text: When the Philistines heard that David had been anointed king over Israel, they went up in full force to search for him, but David heard about it and went down to the stronghold.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:18
verses.text: Now the Philistines had come and spread out in the Valley of Rephaim;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:19
verses.text: so David inquired of the LORD, "Shall I go and attack the Philistines? Will you hand them over to me?" The LORD answered him, "Go, for I will surely hand the Philistines over to you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:20
verses.text: So David went to Baal Perazim, and there he defeated them. He said, "As waters break out, the LORD has broken out against my enemies before me." So that place was called Baal Perazim.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:21
verses.text: The Philistines abandoned their idols there, and David and his men carried them off.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:22
verses.text: Once more the Philistines came up and spread out in the Valley of Rephaim;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:23
verses.text: so David inquired of the LORD, and he answered, "Do not go straight up, but circle around behind them and attack them in front of the balsam trees.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:24
verses.text: As soon as you hear the sound of marching in the tops of the balsam trees, move quickly, because that will mean the LORD has gone out in front of you to strike the Philistine army."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 5:25
verses.text: So David did as the LORD commanded him, and he struck down the Philistines all the way from Gibeon to Gezer.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:1
verses.text: David again brought together out of Israel chosen men, thirty thousand in all.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:2
verses.text: He and all his men set out from Baalah of Judah to bring up from there the ark of God, which is called by the Name, the name of the LORD Almighty, who is enthroned between the cherubim that are on the ark.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:3
verses.text: They set the ark of God on a new cart and brought it from the house of Abinadab, which was on the hill. Uzzah and Ahio, sons of Abinadab, were guiding the new cart

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:4
verses.text: with the ark of God on it, and Ahio was walking in front of it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:5
verses.text: David and the whole house of Israel were celebrating with all their might before the LORD, with songs and with harps, lyres, tambourines, sistrums and cymbals.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:6
verses.text: When they came to the threshing floor of Nacon, Uzzah reached out and took hold of the ark of God, because the oxen stumbled.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:7
verses.text: The LORD's anger burned against Uzzah because of his irreverent act; therefore God struck him down and he died there beside the ark of God.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:8
verses.text: Then David was angry because the LORD's wrath had broken out against Uzzah, and to this day that place is called Perez Uzzah.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:9
verses.text: David was afraid of the LORD that day and said, "How can the ark of the LORD ever come to me?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:10
verses.text: He was not willing to take the ark of the LORD to be with him in the City of David. Instead, he took it aside to the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:11
verses.text: The ark of the LORD remained in the house of Obed-Edom the Gittite for three months, and the LORD blessed him and his entire household.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:12
verses.text: Now King David was told, "The LORD has blessed the household of Obed-Edom and everything he has, because of the ark of God." So David went down and brought up the ark of God from the house of Obed-Edom to the City of David with rejoicing.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:13
verses.text: When those who were carrying the ark of the LORD had taken six steps, he sacrificed a bull and a fattened calf.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:14
verses.text: David, wearing a linen ephod, danced before the LORD with all his might,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:15
verses.text: while he and the entire house of Israel brought up the ark of the LORD with shouts and the sound of trumpets.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:16
verses.text: As the ark of the LORD was entering the City of David, Michal daughter of Saul watched from a window. And when she saw King David leaping and dancing before the LORD, she despised him in her heart.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:17
verses.text: They brought the ark of the LORD and set it in its place inside the tent that David had pitched for it, and David sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings before the LORD.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:18
verses.text: After he had finished sacrificing the burnt offerings and fellowship offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the LORD Almighty.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:19
verses.text: Then he gave a loaf of bread, a cake of dates and a cake of raisins to each person in the whole crowd of Israelites, both men and women. And all the people went to their homes.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:20
verses.text: When David returned home to bless his household, Michal daughter of Saul came out to meet him and said, "How the king of Israel has distinguished himself today, disrobing in the sight of the slave girls of his servants as any vulgar fellow would!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:21
verses.text: David said to Michal, "It was before the LORD, who chose me rather than your father or anyone from his house when he appointed me ruler over the LORD's people Israel-I will celebrate before the LORD.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:22
verses.text: I will become even more undignified than this, and I will be humiliated in my own eyes. But by these slave girls you spoke of, I will be held in honor."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 6:23
verses.text: And Michal daughter of Saul had no children to the day of her death.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:1
verses.text: After the king was settled in his palace and the LORD had given him rest from all his enemies around him,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:2
verses.text: he said to Nathan the prophet, "Here I am, living in a palace of cedar, while the ark of God remains in a tent."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:3
verses.text: Nathan replied to the king, "Whatever you have in mind, go ahead and do it, for the LORD is with you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:4
verses.text: That night the word of the LORD came to Nathan, saying:

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:5
verses.text: "Go and tell my servant David, 'This is what the LORD says: Are you the one to build me a house to dwell in?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:6
verses.text: I have not dwelt in a house from the day I brought the Israelites up out of Egypt to this day. I have been moving from place to place with a tent as my dwelling.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:7
verses.text: Wherever I have moved with all the Israelites, did I ever say to any of their rulers whom I commanded to shepherd my people Israel, "Why have you not built me a house of cedar?"'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:8
verses.text: "Now then, tell my servant David, 'This is what the LORD Almighty says: I took you from the pasture and from following the flock to be ruler over my people Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:9
verses.text: I have been with you wherever you have gone, and I have cut off all your enemies from before you. Now I will make your name great, like the names of the greatest men of the earth.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:10
verses.text: And I will provide a place for my people Israel and will plant them so that they can have a home of their own and no longer be disturbed. Wicked people will not oppress them anymore, as they did at the beginning

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:11
verses.text: and have done ever since the time I appointed leaders over my people Israel. I will also give you rest from all your enemies. "'The LORD declares to you that the LORD himself will establish a house for you:

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:12
verses.text: When your days are over and you rest with your fathers, I will raise up your offspring to succeed you, who will come from your own body, and I will establish his kingdom.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:13
verses.text: He is the one who will build a house for my Name, and I will establish the throne of his kingdom forever.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:14
verses.text: I will be his father, and he will be my son. When he does wrong, I will punish him with the rod of men, with floggings inflicted by men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:15
verses.text: But my love will never be taken away from him, as I took it away from Saul, whom I removed from before you.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:16
verses.text: Your house and your kingdom will endure forever before me; your throne will be established forever.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:17
verses.text: Nathan reported to David all the words of this entire revelation.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:18
verses.text: Then King David went in and sat before the LORD, and he said: "Who am I, O Sovereign LORD, and what is my family, that you have brought me this far?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:19
verses.text: And as if this were not enough in your sight, O Sovereign LORD, you have also spoken about the future of the house of your servant. Is this your usual way of dealing with man, O Sovereign LORD?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:20
verses.text: "What more can David say to you? For you know your servant, O Sovereign LORD.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:21
verses.text: For the sake of your word and according to your will, you have done this great thing and made it known to your servant.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:22
verses.text: "How great you are, O Sovereign LORD! There is no one like you, and there is no God but you, as we have heard with our own ears.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:23
verses.text: And who is like your people Israel-the one nation on earth that God went out to redeem as a people for himself, and to make a name for himself, and to perform great and awesome wonders by driving out nations and their gods from before your people, whom you redeemed from Egypt?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:24
verses.text: You have established your people Israel as your very own forever, and you, O LORD, have become their God.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:25
verses.text: "And now, LORD God, keep forever the promise you have made concerning your servant and his house. Do as you promised,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:26
verses.text: so that your name will be great forever. Then men will say, 'The LORD Almighty is God over Israel!' And the house of your servant David will be established before you.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:27
verses.text: "O LORD Almighty, God of Israel, you have revealed this to your servant, saying, 'I will build a house for you.' So your servant has found courage to offer you this prayer.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:28
verses.text: O Sovereign LORD, you are God! Your words are trustworthy, and you have promised these good things to your servant.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 7:29
verses.text: Now be pleased to bless the house of your servant, that it may continue forever in your sight; for you, O Sovereign LORD, have spoken, and with your blessing the house of your servant will be blessed forever."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:1
verses.text: In the course of time, David defeated the Philistines and subdued them, and he took Metheg Ammah from the control of the Philistines.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:2
verses.text: David also defeated the Moabites. He made them lie down on the ground and measured them off with a length of cord. Every two lengths of them were put to death, and the third length was allowed to live. So the Moabites became subject to David and brought tribute.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:3
verses.text: Moreover, David fought Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah, when he went to restore his control along the Euphrates River.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:4
verses.text: David captured a thousand of his chariots, seven thousand charioteers and twenty thousand foot soldiers. He hamstrung all but a hundred of the chariot horses.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:5
verses.text: When the Arameans of Damascus came to help Hadadezer king of Zobah, David struck down twenty-two thousand of them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:6
verses.text: He put garrisons in the Aramean kingdom of Damascus, and the Arameans became subject to him and brought tribute. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:7
verses.text: David took the gold shields that belonged to the officers of Hadadezer and brought them to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:8
verses.text: From Tebah and Berothai, towns that belonged to Hadadezer, King David took a great quantity of bronze.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:9
verses.text: When Tou king of Hamath heard that David had defeated the entire army of Hadadezer,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:10
verses.text: he sent his son Joram to King David to greet him and congratulate him on his victory in battle over Hadadezer, who had been at war with Tou. Joram brought with him articles of silver and gold and bronze.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:11
verses.text: King David dedicated these articles to the LORD, as he had done with the silver and gold from all the nations he had subdued:

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:12
verses.text: Edom and Moab, the Ammonites and the Philistines, and Amalek. He also dedicated the plunder taken from Hadadezer son of Rehob, king of Zobah.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:13
verses.text: And David became famous after he returned from striking down eighteen thousand Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:14
verses.text: He put garrisons throughout Edom, and all the Edomites became subject to David. The LORD gave David victory wherever he went.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:15
verses.text: David reigned over all Israel, doing what was just and right for all his people.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:16
verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah was over the army; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:17
verses.text: Zadok son of Ahitub and Ahimelech son of Abiathar were priests; Seraiah was secretary;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 8:18
verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites; and David's sons were royal advisers.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:1
verses.text: David asked, "Is there anyone still left of the house of Saul to whom I can show kindness for Jonathan's sake?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:2
verses.text: Now there was a servant of Saul's household named Ziba. They called him to appear before David, and the king said to him, "Are you Ziba?Your servant," he replied.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:3
verses.text: The king asked, "Is there no one still left of the house of Saul to whom I can show God's kindness?" Ziba answered the king, "There is still a son of Jonathan; he is crippled in both feet."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:4
verses.text: "Where is he?" the king asked. Ziba answered, "He is at the house of Makir son of Ammiel in Lo Debar."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:5
verses.text: So King David had him brought from Lo Debar, from the house of Makir son of Ammiel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:6
verses.text: When Mephibosheth son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, came to David, he bowed down to pay him honor. David said, "Mephibosheth!Your servant," he replied.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:7
verses.text: "Don't be afraid," David said to him, "for I will surely show you kindness for the sake of your father Jonathan. I will restore to you all the land that belonged to your grandfather Saul, and you will always eat at my table."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:8
verses.text: Mephibosheth bowed down and said, "What is your servant, that you should notice a dead dog like me?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:9
verses.text: Then the king summoned Ziba, Saul's servant, and said to him, "I have given your master's grandson everything that belonged to Saul and his family.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:10
verses.text: You and your sons and your servants are to farm the land for him and bring in the crops, so that your master's grandson may be provided for. And Mephibosheth, grandson of your master, will always eat at my table." (Now Ziba had fifteen sons and twenty servants.)

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:11
verses.text: Then Ziba said to the king, "Your servant will do whatever my lord the king commands his servant to do." So Mephibosheth ate at David's table like one of the king's sons.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:12
verses.text: Mephibosheth had a young son named Mica, and all the members of Ziba's household were servants of Mephibosheth.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 9:13
verses.text: And Mephibosheth lived in Jerusalem, because he always ate at the king's table, and he was crippled in both feet.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:1
verses.text: In the course of time, the king of the Ammonites died, and his son Hanun succeeded him as king.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:2
verses.text: David thought, "I will show kindness to Hanun son of Nahash, just as his father showed kindness to me." So David sent a delegation to express his sympathy to Hanun concerning his father. When David's men came to the land of the Ammonites,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:3
verses.text: the Ammonite nobles said to Hanun their lord, "Do you think David is honoring your father by sending men to you to express sympathy? Hasn't David sent them to you to explore the city and spy it out and overthrow it?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:4
verses.text: So Hanun seized David's men, shaved off half of each man's beard, cut off their garments in the middle at the buttocks, and sent them away.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:5
verses.text: When David was told about this, he sent messengers to meet the men, for they were greatly humiliated. The king said, "Stay at Jericho till your beards have grown, and then come back."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:6
verses.text: When the Ammonites realized that they had become a stench in David's nostrils, they hired twenty thousand Aramean foot soldiers from Beth Rehob and Zobah, as well as the king of Maacah with a thousand men, and also twelve thousand men from Tob.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:7
verses.text: On hearing this, David sent Joab out with the entire army of fighting men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:8
verses.text: The Ammonites came out and drew up in battle formation at the entrance to their city gate, while the Arameans of Zobah and Rehob and the men of Tob and Maacah were by themselves in the open country.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:9
verses.text: Joab saw that there were battle lines in front of him and behind him; so he selected some of the best troops in Israel and deployed them against the Arameans.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:10
verses.text: He put the rest of the men under the command of Abishai his brother and deployed them against the Ammonites.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:11
verses.text: Joab said, "If the Arameans are too strong for me, then you are to come to my rescue; but if the Ammonites are too strong for you, then I will come to rescue you.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:12
verses.text: Be strong and let us fight bravely for our people and the cities of our God. The LORD will do what is good in his sight."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:13
verses.text: Then Joab and the troops with him advanced to fight the Arameans, and they fled before him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:14
verses.text: When the Ammonites saw that the Arameans were fleeing, they fled before Abishai and went inside the city. So Joab returned from fighting the Ammonites and came to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:15
verses.text: After the Arameans saw that they had been routed by Israel, they regrouped.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:16
verses.text: Hadadezer had Arameans brought from beyond the River; they went to Helam, with Shobach the commander of Hadadezer's army leading them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:17
verses.text: When David was told of this, he gathered all Israel, crossed the Jordan and went to Helam. The Arameans formed their battle lines to meet David and fought against him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:18
verses.text: But they fled before Israel, and David killed seven hundred of their charioteers and forty thousand of their foot soldiers. He also struck down Shobach the commander of their army, and he died there.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 10:19
verses.text: When all the kings who were vassals of Hadadezer saw that they had been defeated by Israel, they made peace with the Israelites and became subject to them. So the Arameans were afraid to help the Ammonites anymore.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:1
verses.text: In the spring, at the time when kings go off to war, David sent Joab out with the king's men and the whole Israelite army. They destroyed the Ammonites and besieged Rabbah. But David remained in Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:2
verses.text: One evening David got up from his bed and walked around on the roof of the palace. From the roof he saw a woman bathing. The woman was very beautiful,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:3
verses.text: and David sent someone to find out about her. The man said, "Isn't this Bathsheba, the daughter of Eliam and the wife of Uriah the Hittite?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:4
verses.text: Then David sent messengers to get her. She came to him, and he slept with her. (She had purified herself from her uncleanness.) Then she went back home.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:5
verses.text: The woman conceived and sent word to David, saying, "I am pregnant."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:6
verses.text: So David sent this word to Joab: "Send me Uriah the Hittite." And Joab sent him to David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:7
verses.text: When Uriah came to him, David asked him how Joab was, how the soldiers were and how the war was going.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:8
verses.text: Then David said to Uriah, "Go down to your house and wash your feet." So Uriah left the palace, and a gift from the king was sent after him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:9
verses.text: But Uriah slept at the entrance to the palace with all his master's servants and did not go down to his house.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:10
verses.text: When David was told, "Uriah did not go home," he asked him, "Haven't you just come from a distance? Why didn't you go home?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:11
verses.text: Uriah said to David, "The ark and Israel and Judah are staying in tents, and my master Joab and my lord's men are camped in the open fields. How could I go to my house to eat and drink and lie with my wife? As surely as you live, I will not do such a thing!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:12
verses.text: Then David said to him, "Stay here one more day, and tomorrow I will send you back." So Uriah remained in Jerusalem that day and the next.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:13
verses.text: At David's invitation, he ate and drank with him, and David made him drunk. But in the evening Uriah went out to sleep on his mat among his master's servants; he did not go home.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:14
verses.text: In the morning David wrote a letter to Joab and sent it with Uriah.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:15
verses.text: In it he wrote, "Put Uriah in the front line where the fighting is fiercest. Then withdraw from him so he will be struck down and die."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:16
verses.text: So while Joab had the city under siege, he put Uriah at a place where he knew the strongest defenders were.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:17
verses.text: When the men of the city came out and fought against Joab, some of the men in David's army fell; moreover, Uriah the Hittite died.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:18
verses.text: Joab sent David a full account of the battle.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:19
verses.text: He instructed the messenger: "When you have finished giving the king this account of the battle,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:20
verses.text: the king's anger may flare up, and he may ask you, 'Why did you get so close to the city to fight? Didn't you know they would shoot arrows from the wall?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:21
verses.text: Who killed Abimelech son of Jerub-Besheth? Didn't a woman throw an upper millstone on him from the wall, so that he died in Thebez? Why did you get so close to the wall?' If he asks you this, then say to him, 'Also, your servant Uriah the Hittite is dead.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:22
verses.text: The messenger set out, and when he arrived he told David everything Joab had sent him to say.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:23
verses.text: The messenger said to David, "The men overpowered us and came out against us in the open, but we drove them back to the entrance to the city gate.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:24
verses.text: Then the archers shot arrows at your servants from the wall, and some of the king's men died. Moreover, your servant Uriah the Hittite is dead."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:25
verses.text: David told the messenger, "Say this to Joab: 'Don't let this upset you; the sword devours one as well as another. Press the attack against the city and destroy it.' Say this to encourage Joab."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:26
verses.text: When Uriah's wife heard that her husband was dead, she mourned for him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 11:27
verses.text: After the time of mourning was over, David had her brought to his house, and she became his wife and bore him a son. But the thing David had done displeased the LORD.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:1
verses.text: The LORD sent Nathan to David. When he came to him, he said, "There were two men in a certain town, one rich and the other poor.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:2
verses.text: The rich man had a very large number of sheep and cattle,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:3
verses.text: but the poor man had nothing except one little ewe lamb he had bought. He raised it, and it grew up with him and his children. It shared his food, drank from his cup and even slept in his arms. It was like a daughter to him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:4
verses.text: "Now a traveler came to the rich man, but the rich man refrained from taking one of his own sheep or cattle to prepare a meal for the traveler who had come to him. Instead, he took the ewe lamb that belonged to the poor man and prepared it for the one who had come to him."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:5
verses.text: David burned with anger against the man and said to Nathan, "As surely as the LORD lives, the man who did this deserves to die!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:6
verses.text: He must pay for that lamb four times over, because he did such a thing and had no pity."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:7
verses.text: Then Nathan said to David, "You are the man! This is what the LORD, the God of Israel, says: 'I anointed you king over Israel, and I delivered you from the hand of Saul.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:8
verses.text: I gave your master's house to you, and your master's wives into your arms. I gave you the house of Israel and Judah. And if all this had been too little, I would have given you even more.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:9
verses.text: Why did you despise the word of the LORD by doing what is evil in his eyes? You struck down Uriah the Hittite with the sword and took his wife to be your own. You killed him with the sword of the Ammonites.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:10
verses.text: Now, therefore, the sword will never depart from your house, because you despised me and took the wife of Uriah the Hittite to be your own.'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:11
verses.text: "This is what the LORD says: 'Out of your own household I am going to bring calamity upon you. Before your very eyes I will take your wives and give them to one who is close to you, and he will lie with your wives in broad daylight.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:12
verses.text: You did it in secret, but I will do this thing in broad daylight before all Israel.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:13
verses.text: Then David said to Nathan, "I have sinned against the LORD." Nathan replied, "The LORD has taken away your sin. You are not going to die.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:14
verses.text: But because by doing this you have made the enemies of the LORD show utter contempt, the son born to you will die."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:15
verses.text: After Nathan had gone home, the LORD struck the child that Uriah's wife had borne to David, and he became ill.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:16
verses.text: David pleaded with God for the child. He fasted and went into his house and spent the nights lying on the ground.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:17
verses.text: The elders of his household stood beside him to get him up from the ground, but he refused, and he would not eat any food with them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:18
verses.text: On the seventh day the child died. David's servants were afraid to tell him that the child was dead, for they thought, "While the child was still living, we spoke to David but he would not listen to us. How can we tell him the child is dead? He may do something desperate."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:19
verses.text: David noticed that his servants were whispering among themselves and he realized the child was dead. "Is the child dead?" he asked. "Yes," they replied, "he is dead."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:20
verses.text: Then David got up from the ground. After he had washed, put on lotions and changed his clothes, he went into the house of the LORD and worshiped. Then he went to his own house, and at his request they served him food, and he ate.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:21
verses.text: His servants asked him, "Why are you acting this way? While the child was alive, you fasted and wept, but now that the child is dead, you get up and eat!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:22
verses.text: He answered, "While the child was still alive, I fasted and wept. I thought, 'Who knows? The LORD may be gracious to me and let the child live.'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:23
verses.text: But now that he is dead, why should I fast? Can I bring him back again? I will go to him, but he will not return to me."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:24
verses.text: Then David comforted his wife Bathsheba, and he went to her and lay with her. She gave birth to a son, and they named him Solomon. The LORD loved him;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:25
verses.text: and because the LORD loved him, he sent word through Nathan the prophet to name him Jedidiah.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:26
verses.text: Meanwhile Joab fought against Rabbah of the Ammonites and captured the royal citadel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:27
verses.text: Joab then sent messengers to David, saying, "I have fought against Rabbah and taken its water supply.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:28
verses.text: Now muster the rest of the troops and besiege the city and capture it. Otherwise I will take the city, and it will be named after me."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:29
verses.text: So David mustered the entire army and went to Rabbah, and attacked and captured it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:30
verses.text: He took the crown from the head of their king -its weight was a talent of gold, and it was set with precious stones-and it was placed on David's head. He took a great quantity of plunder from the city

verses.name: 2 Samuel 12:31
verses.text: and brought out the people who were there, consigning them to labor with saws and with iron picks and axes, and he made them work at brickmaking. He did this to all the Ammonite towns. Then David and his entire army returned to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:1
verses.text: In the course of time, Amnon son of David fell in love with Tamar, the beautiful sister of Absalom son of David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:2
verses.text: Amnon became frustrated to the point of illness on account of his sister Tamar, for she was a virgin, and it seemed impossible for him to do anything to her.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:3
verses.text: Now Amnon had a friend named Jonadab son of Shimeah, David's brother. Jonadab was a very shrewd man.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:4
verses.text: He asked Amnon, "Why do you, the king's son, look so haggard morning after morning? Won't you tell me?" Amnon said to him, "I'm in love with Tamar, my brother Absalom's sister."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:5
verses.text: "Go to bed and pretend to be ill," Jonadab said. "When your father comes to see you, say to him, 'I would like my sister Tamar to come and give me something to eat. Let her prepare the food in my sight so I may watch her and then eat it from her hand.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:6
verses.text: So Amnon lay down and pretended to be ill. When the king came to see him, Amnon said to him, "I would like my sister Tamar to come and make some special bread in my sight, so I may eat from her hand."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:7
verses.text: David sent word to Tamar at the palace: "Go to the house of your brother Amnon and prepare some food for him."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:8
verses.text: So Tamar went to the house of her brother Amnon, who was lying down. She took some dough, kneaded it, made the bread in his sight and baked it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:9
verses.text: Then she took the pan and served him the bread, but he refused to eat. "Send everyone out of here," Amnon said. So everyone left him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:10
verses.text: Then Amnon said to Tamar, "Bring the food here into my bedroom so I may eat from your hand." And Tamar took the bread she had prepared and brought it to her brother Amnon in his bedroom.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:11
verses.text: But when she took it to him to eat, he grabbed her and said, "Come to bed with me, my sister."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:12
verses.text: "Don't, my brother!" she said to him. "Don't force me. Such a thing should not be done in Israel! Don't do this wicked thing.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:13
verses.text: What about me? Where could I get rid of my disgrace? And what about you? You would be like one of the wicked fools in Israel. Please speak to the king; he will not keep me from being married to you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:14
verses.text: But he refused to listen to her, and since he was stronger than she, he raped her.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:15
verses.text: Then Amnon hated her with intense hatred. In fact, he hated her more than he had loved her. Amnon said to her, "Get up and get out!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:16
verses.text: "No!" she said to him. "Sending me away would be a greater wrong than what you have already done to me." But he refused to listen to her.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:17
verses.text: He called his personal servant and said, "Get this woman out of here and bolt the door after her."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:18
verses.text: So his servant put her out and bolted the door after her. She was wearing a richly ornamented robe, for this was the kind of garment the virgin daughters of the king wore.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:19
verses.text: Tamar put ashes on her head and tore the ornamented robe she was wearing. She put her hand on her head and went away, weeping aloud as she went.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:20
verses.text: Her brother Absalom said to her, "Has that Amnon, your brother, been with you? Be quiet now, my sister; he is your brother. Don't take this thing to heart." And Tamar lived in her brother Absalom's house, a desolate woman.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:21
verses.text: When King David heard all this, he was furious.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:22
verses.text: Absalom never said a word to Amnon, either good or bad; he hated Amnon because he had disgraced his sister Tamar.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:23
verses.text: Two years later, when Absalom's sheepshearers were at Baal Hazor near the border of Ephraim, he invited all the king's sons to come there.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:24
verses.text: Absalom went to the king and said, "Your servant has had shearers come. Will the king and his officials please join me?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:25
verses.text: "No, my son," the king replied. "All of us should not go; we would only be a burden to you." Although Absalom urged him, he still refused to go, but gave him his blessing.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:26
verses.text: Then Absalom said, "If not, please let my brother Amnon come with us." The king asked him, "Why should he go with you?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:27
verses.text: But Absalom urged him, so he sent with him Amnon and the rest of the king's sons.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:28
verses.text: Absalom ordered his men, "Listen! When Amnon is in high spirits from drinking wine and I say to you, 'Strike Amnon down,' then kill him. Don't be afraid. Have not I given you this order? Be strong and brave."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:29
verses.text: So Absalom's men did to Amnon what Absalom had ordered. Then all the king's sons got up, mounted their mules and fled.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:30
verses.text: While they were on their way, the report came to David: "Absalom has struck down all the king's sons; not one of them is left."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:31
verses.text: The king stood up, tore his clothes and lay down on the ground; and all his servants stood by with their clothes torn.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:32
verses.text: But Jonadab son of Shimeah, David's brother, said, "My lord should not think that they killed all the princes; only Amnon is dead. This has been Absalom's expressed intention ever since the day Amnon raped his sister Tamar.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:33
verses.text: My lord the king should not be concerned about the report that all the king's sons are dead. Only Amnon is dead."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:34
verses.text: Meanwhile, Absalom had fled. Now the man standing watch looked up and saw many people on the road west of him, coming down the side of the hill. The watchman went and told the king, "I see men in the direction of Horonaim, on the side of the hill."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:35
verses.text: Jonadab said to the king, "See, the king's sons are here; it has happened just as your servant said."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:36
verses.text: As he finished speaking, the king's sons came in, wailing loudly. The king, too, and all his servants wept very bitterly.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:37
verses.text: Absalom fled and went to Talmai son of Ammihud, the king of Geshur. But King David mourned for his son every day.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:38
verses.text: After Absalom fled and went to Geshur, he stayed there three years.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 13:39
verses.text: And the spirit of the king longed to go to Absalom, for he was consoled concerning Amnon's death.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:1
verses.text: Joab son of Zeruiah knew that the king's heart longed for Absalom.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:2
verses.text: So Joab sent someone to Tekoa and had a wise woman brought from there. He said to her, "Pretend you are in mourning. Dress in mourning clothes, and don't use any cosmetic lotions. Act like a woman who has spent many days grieving for the dead.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:3
verses.text: Then go to the king and speak these words to him." And Joab put the words in her mouth.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:4
verses.text: When the woman from Tekoa went to the king, she fell with her face to the ground to pay him honor, and she said, "Help me, O king!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:5
verses.text: The king asked her, "What is troubling you?" She said, "I am indeed a widow; my husband is dead.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:6
verses.text: I your servant had two sons. They got into a fight with each other in the field, and no one was there to separate them. One struck the other and killed him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:7
verses.text: Now the whole clan has risen up against your servant; they say, 'Hand over the one who struck his brother down, so that we may put him to death for the life of his brother whom he killed; then we will get rid of the heir as well.' They would put out the only burning coal I have left, leaving my husband neither name nor descendant on the face of the earth."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:8
verses.text: The king said to the woman, "Go home, and I will issue an order in your behalf."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:9
verses.text: But the woman from Tekoa said to him, "My lord the king, let the blame rest on me and on my father's family, and let the king and his throne be without guilt."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:10
verses.text: The king replied, "If anyone says anything to you, bring him to me, and he will not bother you again."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:11
verses.text: She said, "Then let the king invoke the LORD his God to prevent the avenger of blood from adding to the destruction, so that my son will not be destroyed.As surely as the LORD lives," he said, "not one hair of your son's head will fall to the ground."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:12
verses.text: Then the woman said, "Let your servant speak a word to my lord the king.Speak," he replied.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:13
verses.text: The woman said, "Why then have you devised a thing like this against the people of God? When the king says this, does he not convict himself, for the king has not brought back his banished son?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:14
verses.text: Like water spilled on the ground, which cannot be recovered, so we must die. But God does not take away life; instead, he devises ways so that a banished person may not remain estranged from him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:15
verses.text: "And now I have come to say this to my lord the king because the people have made me afraid. Your servant thought, 'I will speak to the king; perhaps he will do what his servant asks.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:16
verses.text: Perhaps the king will agree to deliver his servant from the hand of the man who is trying to cut off both me and my son from the inheritance God gave us.'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:17
verses.text: "And now your servant says, 'May the word of my lord the king bring me rest, for my lord the king is like an angel of God in discerning good and evil. May the LORD your God be with you.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:18
verses.text: Then the king said to the woman, "Do not keep from me the answer to what I am going to ask you.Let my lord the king speak," the woman said.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:19
verses.text: The king asked, "Isn't the hand of Joab with you in all this?" The woman answered, "As surely as you live, my lord the king, no one can turn to the right or to the left from anything my lord the king says. Yes, it was your servant Joab who instructed me to do this and who put all these words into the mouth of your servant.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:20
verses.text: Your servant Joab did this to change the present situation. My lord has wisdom like that of an angel of God-he knows everything that happens in the land."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:21
verses.text: The king said to Joab, "Very well, I will do it. Go, bring back the young man Absalom."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:22
verses.text: Joab fell with his face to the ground to pay him honor, and he blessed the king. Joab said, "Today your servant knows that he has found favor in your eyes, my lord the king, because the king has granted his servant's request."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:23
verses.text: Then Joab went to Geshur and brought Absalom back to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:24
verses.text: But the king said, "He must go to his own house; he must not see my face." So Absalom went to his own house and did not see the face of the king.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:25
verses.text: In all Israel there was not a man so highly praised for his handsome appearance as Absalom. From the top of his head to the sole of his foot there was no blemish in him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:26
verses.text: Whenever he cut the hair of his head-he used to cut his hair from time to time when it became too heavy for him-he would weigh it, and its weight was two hundred shekels by the royal standard.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:27
verses.text: Three sons and a daughter were born to Absalom. The daughter's name was Tamar, and she became a beautiful woman.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:28
verses.text: Absalom lived two years in Jerusalem without seeing the king's face.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:29
verses.text: Then Absalom sent for Joab in order to send him to the king, but Joab refused to come to him. So he sent a second time, but he refused to come.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:30
verses.text: Then he said to his servants, "Look, Joab's field is next to mine, and he has barley there. Go and set it on fire." So Absalom's servants set the field on fire.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:31
verses.text: Then Joab did go to Absalom's house and he said to him, "Why have your servants set my field on fire?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:32
verses.text: Absalom said to Joab, "Look, I sent word to you and said, 'Come here so I can send you to the king to ask, "Why have I come from Geshur? It would be better for me if I were still there!"' Now then, I want to see the king's face, and if I am guilty of anything, let him put me to death."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 14:33
verses.text: So Joab went to the king and told him this. Then the king summoned Absalom, and he came in and bowed down with his face to the ground before the king. And the king kissed Absalom.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:1
verses.text: In the course of time, Absalom provided himself with a chariot and horses and with fifty men to run ahead of him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:2
verses.text: He would get up early and stand by the side of the road leading to the city gate. Whenever anyone came with a complaint to be placed before the king for a decision, Absalom would call out to him, "What town are you from?" He would answer, "Your servant is from one of the tribes of Israel."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:3
verses.text: Then Absalom would say to him, "Look, your claims are valid and proper, but there is no representative of the king to hear you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:4
verses.text: And Absalom would add, "If only I were appointed judge in the land! Then everyone who has a complaint or case could come to me and I would see that he gets justice."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:5
verses.text: Also, whenever anyone approached him to bow down before him, Absalom would reach out his hand, take hold of him and kiss him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:6
verses.text: Absalom behaved in this way toward all the Israelites who came to the king asking for justice, and so he stole the hearts of the men of Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:7
verses.text: At the end of four years, Absalom said to the king, "Let me go to Hebron and fulfill a vow I made to the LORD.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:8
verses.text: While your servant was living at Geshur in Aram, I made this vow: 'If the LORD takes me back to Jerusalem, I will worship the LORD in Hebron. '"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:9
verses.text: The king said to him, "Go in peace." So he went to Hebron.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:10
verses.text: Then Absalom sent secret messengers throughout the tribes of Israel to say, "As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpets, then say, 'Absalom is king in Hebron.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:11
verses.text: Two hundred men from Jerusalem had accompanied Absalom. They had been invited as guests and went quite innocently, knowing nothing about the matter.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:12
verses.text: While Absalom was offering sacrifices, he also sent for Ahithophel the Gilonite, David's counselor, to come from Giloh, his hometown. And so the conspiracy gained strength, and Absalom's following kept on increasing.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:13
verses.text: A messenger came and told David, "The hearts of the men of Israel are with Absalom."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:14
verses.text: Then David said to all his officials who were with him in Jerusalem, "Come! We must flee, or none of us will escape from Absalom. We must leave immediately, or he will move quickly to overtake us and bring ruin upon us and put the city to the sword."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:15
verses.text: The king's officials answered him, "Your servants are ready to do whatever our lord the king chooses."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:16
verses.text: The king set out, with his entire household following him; but he left ten concubines to take care of the palace.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:17
verses.text: So the king set out, with all the people following him, and they halted at a place some distance away.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:18
verses.text: All his men marched past him, along with all the Kerethites and Pelethites; and all the six hundred Gittites who had accompanied him from Gath marched before the king.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:19
verses.text: The king said to Ittai the Gittite, "Why should you come along with us? Go back and stay with King Absalom. You are a foreigner, an exile from your homeland.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:20
verses.text: You came only yesterday. And today shall I make you wander about with us, when I do not know where I am going? Go back, and take your countrymen. May kindness and faithfulness be with you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:21
verses.text: But Ittai replied to the king, "As surely as the LORD lives, and as my lord the king lives, wherever my lord the king may be, whether it means life or death, there will your servant be."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:22
verses.text: David said to Ittai, "Go ahead, march on." So Ittai the Gittite marched on with all his men and the families that were with him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:23
verses.text: The whole countryside wept aloud as all the people passed by. The king also crossed the Kidron Valley, and all the people moved on toward the desert.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:24
verses.text: Zadok was there, too, and all the Levites who were with him were carrying the ark of the covenant of God. They set down the ark of God, and Abiathar offered sacrifices until all the people had finished leaving the city.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:25
verses.text: Then the king said to Zadok, "Take the ark of God back into the city. If I find favor in the LORD's eyes, he will bring me back and let me see it and his dwelling place again.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:26
verses.text: But if he says, 'I am not pleased with you,' then I am ready; let him do to me whatever seems good to him."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:27
verses.text: The king also said to Zadok the priest, "Aren't you a seer? Go back to the city in peace, with your son Ahimaaz and Jonathan son of Abiathar. You and Abiathar take your two sons with you.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:28
verses.text: I will wait at the fords in the desert until word comes from you to inform me."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:29
verses.text: So Zadok and Abiathar took the ark of God back to Jerusalem and stayed there.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:30
verses.text: But David continued up the Mount of Olives, weeping as he went; his head was covered and he was barefoot. All the people with him covered their heads too and were weeping as they went up.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:31
verses.text: Now David had been told, "Ahithophel is among the conspirators with Absalom." So David prayed, "O LORD, turn Ahithophel's counsel into foolishness."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:32
verses.text: When David arrived at the summit, where people used to worship God, Hushai the Arkite was there to meet him, his robe torn and dust on his head.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:33
verses.text: David said to him, "If you go with me, you will be a burden to me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:34
verses.text: But if you return to the city and say to Absalom, 'I will be your servant, O king; I was your father's servant in the past, but now I will be your servant,' then you can help me by frustrating Ahithophel's advice.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:35
verses.text: Won't the priests Zadok and Abiathar be there with you? Tell them anything you hear in the king's palace.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:36
verses.text: Their two sons, Ahimaaz son of Zadok and Jonathan son of Abiathar, are there with them. Send them to me with anything you hear."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 15:37
verses.text: So David's friend Hushai arrived at Jerusalem as Absalom was entering the city.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:1
verses.text: When David had gone a short distance beyond the summit, there was Ziba, the steward of Mephibosheth, waiting to meet him. He had a string of donkeys saddled and loaded with two hundred loaves of bread, a hundred cakes of raisins, a hundred cakes of figs and a skin of wine.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:2
verses.text: The king asked Ziba, "Why have you brought these?" Ziba answered, "The donkeys are for the king's household to ride on, the bread and fruit are for the men to eat, and the wine is to refresh those who become exhausted in the desert."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:3
verses.text: The king then asked, "Where is your master's grandson?" Ziba said to him, "He is staying in Jerusalem, because he thinks, 'Today the house of Israel will give me back my grandfather's kingdom.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:4
verses.text: Then the king said to Ziba, "All that belonged to Mephibosheth is now yours.I humbly bow," Ziba said. "May I find favor in your eyes, my lord the king."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:5
verses.text: As King David approached Bahurim, a man from the same clan as Saul's family came out from there. His name was Shimei son of Gera, and he cursed as he came out.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:6
verses.text: He pelted David and all the king's officials with stones, though all the troops and the special guard were on David's right and left.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:7
verses.text: As he cursed, Shimei said, "Get out, get out, you man of blood, you scoundrel!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:8
verses.text: The LORD has repaid you for all the blood you shed in the household of Saul, in whose place you have reigned. The LORD has handed the kingdom over to your son Absalom. You have come to ruin because you are a man of blood!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:9
verses.text: Then Abishai son of Zeruiah said to the king, "Why should this dead dog curse my lord the king? Let me go over and cut off his head."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:10
verses.text: But the king said, "What do you and I have in common, you sons of Zeruiah? If he is cursing because the LORD said to him, 'Curse David,' who can ask, 'Why do you do this?'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:11
verses.text: David then said to Abishai and all his officials, "My son, who is of my own flesh, is trying to take my life. How much more, then, this Benjamite! Leave him alone; let him curse, for the LORD has told him to.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:12
verses.text: It may be that the LORD will see my distress and repay me with good for the cursing I am receiving today."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:13
verses.text: So David and his men continued along the road while Shimei was going along the hillside opposite him, cursing as he went and throwing stones at him and showering him with dirt.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:14
verses.text: The king and all the people with him arrived at their destination exhausted. And there he refreshed himself.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:15
verses.text: Meanwhile, Absalom and all the men of Israel came to Jerusalem, and Ahithophel was with him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:16
verses.text: Then Hushai the Arkite, David's friend, went to Absalom and said to him, "Long live the king! Long live the king!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:17
verses.text: Absalom asked Hushai, "Is this the love you show your friend? Why didn't you go with your friend?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:18
verses.text: Hushai said to Absalom, "No, the one chosen by the LORD, by these people, and by all the men of Israel-his I will be, and I will remain with him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:19
verses.text: Furthermore, whom should I serve? Should I not serve the son? Just as I served your father, so I will serve you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:20
verses.text: Absalom said to Ahithophel, "Give us your advice. What should we do?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:21
verses.text: Ahithophel answered, "Lie with your father's concubines whom he left to take care of the palace. Then all Israel will hear that you have made yourself a stench in your father's nostrils, and the hands of everyone with you will be strengthened."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:22
verses.text: So they pitched a tent for Absalom on the roof, and he lay with his father's concubines in the sight of all Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 16:23
verses.text: Now in those days the advice Ahithophel gave was like that of one who inquires of God. That was how both David and Absalom regarded all of Ahithophel's advice.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:1
verses.text: Ahithophel said to Absalom, "I would choose twelve thousand men and set out tonight in pursuit of David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:2
verses.text: I would attack him while he is weary and weak. I would strike him with terror, and then all the people with him will flee. I would strike down only the king

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:3
verses.text: and bring all the people back to you. The death of the man you seek will mean the return of all; all the people will be unharmed."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:4
verses.text: This plan seemed good to Absalom and to all the elders of Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:5
verses.text: But Absalom said, "Summon also Hushai the Arkite, so we can hear what he has to say."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:6
verses.text: When Hushai came to him, Absalom said, "Ahithophel has given this advice. Should we do what he says? If not, give us your opinion."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:7
verses.text: Hushai replied to Absalom, "The advice Ahithophel has given is not good this time.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:8
