verses.text: You know your father and his men; they are fighters, and as fierce as a wild bear robbed of her cubs. Besides, your father is an experienced fighter; he will not spend the night with the troops.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:9
verses.text: Even now, he is hidden in a cave or some other place. If he should attack your troops first, whoever hears about it will say, 'There has been a slaughter among the troops who follow Absalom.'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:10
verses.text: Then even the bravest soldier, whose heart is like the heart of a lion, will melt with fear, for all Israel knows that your father is a fighter and that those with him are brave.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:11
verses.text: "So I advise you: Let all Israel, from Dan to Beersheba-as numerous as the sand on the seashore-be gathered to you, with you yourself leading them into battle.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:12
verses.text: Then we will attack him wherever he may be found, and we will fall on him as dew settles on the ground. Neither he nor any of his men will be left alive.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:13
verses.text: If he withdraws into a city, then all Israel will bring ropes to that city, and we will drag it down to the valley until not even a piece of it can be found."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:14
verses.text: Absalom and all the men of Israel said, "The advice of Hushai the Arkite is better than that of Ahithophel." For the LORD had determined to frustrate the good advice of Ahithophel in order to bring disaster on Absalom.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:15
verses.text: Hushai told Zadok and Abiathar, the priests, "Ahithophel has advised Absalom and the elders of Israel to do such and such, but I have advised them to do so and so.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:16
verses.text: Now send a message immediately and tell David, 'Do not spend the night at the fords in the desert; cross over without fail, or the king and all the people with him will be swallowed up.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:17
verses.text: Jonathan and Ahimaaz were staying at En Rogel. A servant girl was to go and inform them, and they were to go and tell King David, for they could not risk being seen entering the city.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:18
verses.text: But a young man saw them and told Absalom. So the two of them left quickly and went to the house of a man in Bahurim. He had a well in his courtyard, and they climbed down into it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:19
verses.text: His wife took a covering and spread it out over the opening of the well and scattered grain over it. No one knew anything about it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:20
verses.text: When Absalom's men came to the woman at the house, they asked, "Where are Ahimaaz and Jonathan?" The woman answered them, "They crossed over the brook." The men searched but found no one, so they returned to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:21
verses.text: After the men had gone, the two climbed out of the well and went to inform King David. They said to him, "Set out and cross the river at once; Ahithophel has advised such and such against you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:22
verses.text: So David and all the people with him set out and crossed the Jordan. By daybreak, no one was left who had not crossed the Jordan.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:23
verses.text: When Ahithophel saw that his advice had not been followed, he saddled his donkey and set out for his house in his hometown. He put his house in order and then hanged himself. So he died and was buried in his father's tomb.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:24
verses.text: David went to Mahanaim, and Absalom crossed the Jordan with all the men of Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:25
verses.text: Absalom had appointed Amasa over the army in place of Joab. Amasa was the son of a man named Jether, an Israelite who had married Abigail, the daughter of Nahash and sister of Zeruiah the mother of Joab.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:26
verses.text: The Israelites and Absalom camped in the land of Gilead.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:27
verses.text: When David came to Mahanaim, Shobi son of Nahash from Rabbah of the Ammonites, and Makir son of Ammiel from Lo Debar, and Barzillai the Gileadite from Rogelim

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:28
verses.text: brought bedding and bowls and articles of pottery. They also brought wheat and barley, flour and roasted grain, beans and lentils,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 17:29
verses.text: honey and curds, sheep, and cheese from cows' milk for David and his people to eat. For they said, "The people have become hungry and tired and thirsty in the desert."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:1
verses.text: David mustered the men who were with him and appointed over them commanders of thousands and commanders of hundreds.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:2
verses.text: David sent the troops out-a third under the command of Joab, a third under Joab's brother Abishai son of Zeruiah, and a third under Ittai the Gittite. The king told the troops, "I myself will surely march out with you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:3
verses.text: But the men said, "You must not go out; if we are forced to flee, they won't care about us. Even if half of us die, they won't care; but you are worth ten thousand of us. It would be better now for you to give us support from the city."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:4
verses.text: The king answered, "I will do whatever seems best to you." So the king stood beside the gate while all the men marched out in units of hundreds and of thousands.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:5
verses.text: The king commanded Joab, Abishai and Ittai, "Be gentle with the young man Absalom for my sake." And all the troops heard the king giving orders concerning Absalom to each of the commanders.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:6
verses.text: The army marched into the field to fight Israel, and the battle took place in the forest of Ephraim.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:7
verses.text: There the army of Israel was defeated by David's men, and the casualties that day were great-twenty thousand men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:8
verses.text: The battle spread out over the whole countryside, and the forest claimed more lives that day than the sword.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:9
verses.text: Now Absalom happened to meet David's men. He was riding his mule, and as the mule went under the thick branches of a large oak, Absalom's head got caught in the tree. He was left hanging in midair, while the mule he was riding kept on going.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:10
verses.text: When one of the men saw this, he told Joab, "I just saw Absalom hanging in an oak tree."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:11
verses.text: Joab said to the man who had told him this, "What! You saw him? Why didn't you strike him to the ground right there? Then I would have had to give you ten shekels of silver and a warrior's belt."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:12
verses.text: But the man replied, "Even if a thousand shekels were weighed out into my hands, I would not lift my hand against the king's son. In our hearing the king commanded you and Abishai and Ittai, 'Protect the young man Absalom for my sake. '

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:13
verses.text: And if I had put my life in jeopardy -and nothing is hidden from the king-you would have kept your distance from me."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:14
verses.text: Joab said, "I'm not going to wait like this for you." So he took three javelins in his hand and plunged them into Absalom's heart while Absalom was still alive in the oak tree.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:15
verses.text: And ten of Joab's armor-bearers surrounded Absalom, struck him and killed him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:16
verses.text: Then Joab sounded the trumpet, and the troops stopped pursuing Israel, for Joab halted them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:17
verses.text: They took Absalom, threw him into a big pit in the forest and piled up a large heap of rocks over him. Meanwhile, all the Israelites fled to their homes.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:18
verses.text: During his lifetime Absalom had taken a pillar and erected it in the King's Valley as a monument to himself, for he thought, "I have no son to carry on the memory of my name." He named the pillar after himself, and it is called Absalom's Monument to this day.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:19
verses.text: Now Ahimaaz son of Zadok said, "Let me run and take the news to the king that the LORD has delivered him from the hand of his enemies."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:20
verses.text: "You are not the one to take the news today," Joab told him. "You may take the news another time, but you must not do so today, because the king's son is dead."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:21
verses.text: Then Joab said to a Cushite, "Go, tell the king what you have seen." The Cushite bowed down before Joab and ran off.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:22
verses.text: Ahimaaz son of Zadok again said to Joab, "Come what may, please let me run behind the Cushite." But Joab replied, "My son, why do you want to go? You don't have any news that will bring you a reward."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:23
verses.text: He said, "Come what may, I want to run." So Joab said, "Run!" Then Ahimaaz ran by way of the plain and outran the Cushite.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:24
verses.text: While David was sitting between the inner and outer gates, the watchman went up to the roof of the gateway by the wall. As he looked out, he saw a man running alone.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:25
verses.text: The watchman called out to the king and reported it. The king said, "If he is alone, he must have good news." And the man came closer and closer.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:26
verses.text: Then the watchman saw another man running, and he called down to the gatekeeper, "Look, another man running alone!" The king said, "He must be bringing good news, too."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:27
verses.text: The watchman said, "It seems to me that the first one runs like Ahimaaz son of Zadok.He's a good man," the king said. "He comes with good news."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:28
verses.text: Then Ahimaaz called out to the king, "All is well!" He bowed down before the king with his face to the ground and said, "Praise be to the LORD your God! He has delivered up the men who lifted their hands against my lord the king."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:29
verses.text: The king asked, "Is the young man Absalom safe?" Ahimaaz answered, "I saw great confusion just as Joab was about to send the king's servant and me, your servant, but I don't know what it was."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:30
verses.text: The king said, "Stand aside and wait here." So he stepped aside and stood there.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:31
verses.text: Then the Cushite arrived and said, "My lord the king, hear the good news! The LORD has delivered you today from all who rose up against you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:32
verses.text: The king asked the Cushite, "Is the young man Absalom safe?" The Cushite replied, "May the enemies of my lord the king and all who rise up to harm you be like that young man."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 18:33
verses.text: The king was shaken. He went up to the room over the gateway and wept. As he went, he said: "O my son Absalom! My son, my son Absalom! If only I had died instead of you-O Absalom, my son, my son!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:1
verses.text: Joab was told, "The king is weeping and mourning for Absalom."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:2
verses.text: And for the whole army the victory that day was turned into mourning, because on that day the troops heard it said, "The king is grieving for his son."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:3
verses.text: The men stole into the city that day as men steal in who are ashamed when they flee from battle.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:4
verses.text: The king covered his face and cried aloud, "O my son Absalom! O Absalom, my son, my son!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:5
verses.text: Then Joab went into the house to the king and said, "Today you have humiliated all your men, who have just saved your life and the lives of your sons and daughters and the lives of your wives and concubines.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:6
verses.text: You love those who hate you and hate those who love you. You have made it clear today that the commanders and their men mean nothing to you. I see that you would be pleased if Absalom were alive today and all of us were dead.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:7
verses.text: Now go out and encourage your men. I swear by the LORD that if you don't go out, not a man will be left with you by nightfall. This will be worse for you than all the calamities that have come upon you from your youth till now."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:8
verses.text: So the king got up and took his seat in the gateway. When the men were told, "The king is sitting in the gateway," they all came before him. Meanwhile, the Israelites had fled to their homes.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:9
verses.text: Throughout the tribes of Israel, the people were all arguing with each other, saying, "The king delivered us from the hand of our enemies; he is the one who rescued us from the hand of the Philistines. But now he has fled the country because of Absalom;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:10
verses.text: and Absalom, whom we anointed to rule over us, has died in battle. So why do you say nothing about bringing the king back?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:11
verses.text: King David sent this message to Zadok and Abiathar, the priests: "Ask the elders of Judah, 'Why should you be the last to bring the king back to his palace, since what is being said throughout Israel has reached the king at his quarters?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:12
verses.text: You are my brothers, my own flesh and blood. So why should you be the last to bring back the king?'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:13
verses.text: And say to Amasa, 'Are you not my own flesh and blood? May God deal with me, be it ever so severely, if from now on you are not the commander of my army in place of Joab.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:14
verses.text: He won over the hearts of all the men of Judah as though they were one man. They sent word to the king, "Return, you and all your men."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:15
verses.text: Then the king returned and went as far as the Jordan. Now the men of Judah had come to Gilgal to go out and meet the king and bring him across the Jordan.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:16
verses.text: Shimei son of Gera, the Benjamite from Bahurim, hurried down with the men of Judah to meet King David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:17
verses.text: With him were a thousand Benjamites, along with Ziba, the steward of Saul's household, and his fifteen sons and twenty servants. They rushed to the Jordan, where the king was.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:18
verses.text: They crossed at the ford to take the king's household over and to do whatever he wished. When Shimei son of Gera crossed the Jordan, he fell prostrate before the king

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:19
verses.text: and said to him, "May my lord not hold me guilty. Do not remember how your servant did wrong on the day my lord the king left Jerusalem. May the king put it out of his mind.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:20
verses.text: For I your servant know that I have sinned, but today I have come here as the first of the whole house of Joseph to come down and meet my lord the king."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:21
verses.text: Then Abishai son of Zeruiah said, "Shouldn't Shimei be put to death for this? He cursed the LORD's anointed."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:22
verses.text: David replied, "What do you and I have in common, you sons of Zeruiah? This day you have become my adversaries! Should anyone be put to death in Israel today? Do I not know that today I am king over Israel?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:23
verses.text: So the king said to Shimei, "You shall not die." And the king promised him on oath.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:24
verses.text: Mephibosheth, Saul's grandson, also went down to meet the king. He had not taken care of his feet or trimmed his mustache or washed his clothes from the day the king left until the day he returned safely.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:25
verses.text: When he came from Jerusalem to meet the king, the king asked him, "Why didn't you go with me, Mephibosheth?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:26
verses.text: He said, "My lord the king, since I your servant am lame, I said, 'I will have my donkey saddled and will ride on it, so I can go with the king.' But Ziba my servant betrayed me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:27
verses.text: And he has slandered your servant to my lord the king. My lord the king is like an angel of God; so do whatever pleases you.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:28
verses.text: All my grandfather's descendants deserved nothing but death from my lord the king, but you gave your servant a place among those who eat at your table. So what right do I have to make any more appeals to the king?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:29
verses.text: The king said to him, "Why say more? I order you and Ziba to divide the fields."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:30
verses.text: Mephibosheth said to the king, "Let him take everything, now that my lord the king has arrived home safely."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:31
verses.text: Barzillai the Gileadite also came down from Rogelim to cross the Jordan with the king and to send him on his way from there.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:32
verses.text: Now Barzillai was a very old man, eighty years of age. He had provided for the king during his stay in Mahanaim, for he was a very wealthy man.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:33
verses.text: The king said to Barzillai, "Cross over with me and stay with me in Jerusalem, and I will provide for you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:34
verses.text: But Barzillai answered the king, "How many more years will I live, that I should go up to Jerusalem with the king?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:35
verses.text: I am now eighty years old. Can I tell the difference between what is good and what is not? Can your servant taste what he eats and drinks? Can I still hear the voices of men and women singers? Why should your servant be an added burden to my lord the king?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:36
verses.text: Your servant will cross over the Jordan with the king for a short distance, but why should the king reward me in this way?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:37
verses.text: Let your servant return, that I may die in my own town near the tomb of my father and mother. But here is your servant Kimham. Let him cross over with my lord the king. Do for him whatever pleases you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:38
verses.text: The king said, "Kimham shall cross over with me, and I will do for him whatever pleases you. And anything you desire from me I will do for you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:39
verses.text: So all the people crossed the Jordan, and then the king crossed over. The king kissed Barzillai and gave him his blessing, and Barzillai returned to his home.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:40
verses.text: When the king crossed over to Gilgal, Kimham crossed with him. All the troops of Judah and half the troops of Israel had taken the king over.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:41
verses.text: Soon all the men of Israel were coming to the king and saying to him, "Why did our brothers, the men of Judah, steal the king away and bring him and his household across the Jordan, together with all his men?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:42
verses.text: All the men of Judah answered the men of Israel, "We did this because the king is closely related to us. Why are you angry about it? Have we eaten any of the king's provisions? Have we taken anything for ourselves?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 19:43
verses.text: Then the men of Israel answered the men of Judah, "We have ten shares in the king; and besides, we have a greater claim on David than you have. So why do you treat us with contempt? Were we not the first to speak of bringing back our king?" But the men of Judah responded even more harshly than the men of Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:1
verses.text: Now a troublemaker named Sheba son of Bicri, a Benjamite, happened to be there. He sounded the trumpet and shouted, "We have no share in David, no part in Jesse's son! Every man to his tent, O Israel!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:2
verses.text: So all the men of Israel deserted David to follow Sheba son of Bicri. But the men of Judah stayed by their king all the way from the Jordan to Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:3
verses.text: When David returned to his palace in Jerusalem, he took the ten concubines he had left to take care of the palace and put them in a house under guard. He provided for them, but did not lie with them. They were kept in confinement till the day of their death, living as widows.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:4
verses.text: Then the king said to Amasa, "Summon the men of Judah to come to me within three days, and be here yourself."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:5
verses.text: But when Amasa went to summon Judah, he took longer than the time the king had set for him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:6
verses.text: David said to Abishai, "Now Sheba son of Bicri will do us more harm than Absalom did. Take your master's men and pursue him, or he will find fortified cities and escape from us."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:7
verses.text: So Joab's men and the Kerethites and Pelethites and all the mighty warriors went out under the command of Abishai. They marched out from Jerusalem to pursue Sheba son of Bicri.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:8
verses.text: While they were at the great rock in Gibeon, Amasa came to meet them. Joab was wearing his military tunic, and strapped over it at his waist was a belt with a dagger in its sheath. As he stepped forward, it dropped out of its sheath.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:9
verses.text: Joab said to Amasa, "How are you, my brother?" Then Joab took Amasa by the beard with his right hand to kiss him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:10
verses.text: Amasa was not on his guard against the dagger in Joab's hand, and Joab plunged it into his belly, and his intestines spilled out on the ground. Without being stabbed again, Amasa died. Then Joab and his brother Abishai pursued Sheba son of Bicri.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:11
verses.text: One of Joab's men stood beside Amasa and said, "Whoever favors Joab, and whoever is for David, let him follow Joab!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:12
verses.text: Amasa lay wallowing in his blood in the middle of the road, and the man saw that all the troops came to a halt there. When he realized that everyone who came up to Amasa stopped, he dragged him from the road into a field and threw a garment over him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:13
verses.text: After Amasa had been removed from the road, all the men went on with Joab to pursue Sheba son of Bicri.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:14
verses.text: Sheba passed through all the tribes of Israel to Abel Beth Maacah and through the entire region of the Berites, who gathered together and followed him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:15
verses.text: All the troops with Joab came and besieged Sheba in Abel Beth Maacah. They built a siege ramp up to the city, and it stood against the outer fortifications. While they were battering the wall to bring it down,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:16
verses.text: a wise woman called from the city, "Listen! Listen! Tell Joab to come here so I can speak to him."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:17
verses.text: He went toward her, and she asked, "Are you Joab?I am," he answered. She said, "Listen to what your servant has to say.I'm listening," he said.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:18
verses.text: She continued, "Long ago they used to say, 'Get your answer at Abel,' and that settled it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:19
verses.text: We are the peaceful and faithful in Israel. You are trying to destroy a city that is a mother in Israel. Why do you want to swallow up the LORD's inheritance?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:20
verses.text: "Far be it from me!" Joab replied, "Far be it from me to swallow up or destroy!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:21
verses.text: That is not the case. A man named Sheba son of Bicri, from the hill country of Ephraim, has lifted up his hand against the king, against David. Hand over this one man, and I'll withdraw from the city." The woman said to Joab, "His head will be thrown to you from the wall."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:22
verses.text: Then the woman went to all the people with her wise advice, and they cut off the head of Sheba son of Bicri and threw it to Joab. So he sounded the trumpet, and his men dispersed from the city, each returning to his home. And Joab went back to the king in Jerusalem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:23
verses.text: Joab was over Israel's entire army; Benaiah son of Jehoiada was over the Kerethites and Pelethites;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:24
verses.text: Adoniram was in charge of forced labor; Jehoshaphat son of Ahilud was recorder;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:25
verses.text: Sheva was secretary; Zadok and Abiathar were priests;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 20:26
verses.text: and Ira the Jairite was David's priest.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:1
verses.text: During the reign of David, there was a famine for three successive years; so David sought the face of the LORD. The LORD said, "It is on account of Saul and his blood-stained house; it is because he put the Gibeonites to death."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:2
verses.text: The king summoned the Gibeonites and spoke to them. (Now the Gibeonites were not a part of Israel but were survivors of the Amorites; the Israelites had sworn to spare them, but Saul in his zeal for Israel and Judah had tried to annihilate them.)

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:3
verses.text: David asked the Gibeonites, "What shall I do for you? How shall I make amends so that you will bless the LORD's inheritance?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:4
verses.text: The Gibeonites answered him, "We have no right to demand silver or gold from Saul or his family, nor do we have the right to put anyone in Israel to death.What do you want me to do for you?" David asked.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:5
verses.text: They answered the king, "As for the man who destroyed us and plotted against us so that we have been decimated and have no place anywhere in Israel,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:6
verses.text: let seven of his male descendants be given to us to be killed and exposed before the LORD at Gibeah of Saul-the Lord 's chosen one." So the king said, "I will give them to you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:7
verses.text: The king spared Mephibosheth son of Jonathan, the son of Saul, because of the oath before the LORD between David and Jonathan son of Saul.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:8
verses.text: But the king took Armoni and Mephibosheth, the two sons of Aiah's daughter Rizpah, whom she had borne to Saul, together with the five sons of Saul's daughter Merab, whom she had borne to Adriel son of Barzillai the Meholathite.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:9
verses.text: He handed them over to the Gibeonites, who killed and exposed them on a hill before the LORD. All seven of them fell together; they were put to death during the first days of the harvest, just as the barley harvest was beginning.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:10
verses.text: Rizpah daughter of Aiah took sackcloth and spread it out for herself on a rock. From the beginning of the harvest till the rain poured down from the heavens on the bodies, she did not let the birds of the air touch them by day or the wild animals by night.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:11
verses.text: When David was told what Aiah's daughter Rizpah, Saul's concubine, had done,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:12
verses.text: he went and took the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan from the citizens of Jabesh Gilead. (They had taken them secretly from the public square at Beth Shan, where the Philistines had hung them after they struck Saul down on Gilboa.)

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:13
verses.text: David brought the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan from there, and the bones of those who had been killed and exposed were gathered up.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:14
verses.text: They buried the bones of Saul and his son Jonathan in the tomb of Saul's father Kish, at Zela in Benjamin, and did everything the king commanded. After that, God answered prayer in behalf of the land.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:15
verses.text: Once again there was a battle between the Philistines and Israel. David went down with his men to fight against the Philistines, and he became exhausted.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:16
verses.text: And Ishbi-Benob, one of the descendants of Rapha, whose bronze spearhead weighed three hundred shekels and who was armed with a new sword, said he would kill David.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:17
verses.text: But Abishai son of Zeruiah came to David's rescue; he struck the Philistine down and killed him. Then David's men swore to him, saying, "Never again will you go out with us to battle, so that the lamp of Israel will not be extinguished."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:18
verses.text: In the course of time, there was another battle with the Philistines, at Gob. At that time Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, one of the descendants of Rapha.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:19
verses.text: In another battle with the Philistines at Gob, Elhanan son of Jaare-Oregim the Bethlehemite killed Goliath the Gittite, who had a spear with a shaft like a weaver's rod.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:20
verses.text: In still another battle, which took place at Gath, there was a huge man with six fingers on each hand and six toes on each foot-twenty-four in all. He also was descended from Rapha.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:21
verses.text: When he taunted Israel, Jonathan son of Shimeah, David's brother, killed him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 21:22
verses.text: These four were descendants of Rapha in Gath, and they fell at the hands of David and his men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:1
verses.text: David sang to the LORD the words of this song when the LORD delivered him from the hand of all his enemies and from the hand of Saul.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:2
verses.text: He said: "The LORD is my rock, my fortress and my deliverer;

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:3
verses.text: my God is my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield and the horn of my salvation. He is my stronghold, my refuge and my savior- from violent men you save me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:4
verses.text: I call to the LORD, who is worthy of praise, and I am saved from my enemies.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:5
verses.text: "The waves of death swirled about me; the torrents of destruction overwhelmed me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:6
verses.text: The cords of the grave coiled around me; the snares of death confronted me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:7
verses.text: In my distress I called to the LORD; I called out to my God. From his temple he heard my voice; my cry came to his ears.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:8
verses.text: "The earth trembled and quaked, the foundations of the heavens shook; they trembled because he was angry.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:9
verses.text: Smoke rose from his nostrils; consuming fire came from his mouth, burning coals blazed out of it.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:10
verses.text: He parted the heavens and came down; dark clouds were under his feet.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:11
verses.text: He mounted the cherubim and flew; he soared on the wings of the wind.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:12
verses.text: He made darkness his canopy around him- the dark rain clouds of the sky.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:13
verses.text: Out of the brightness of his presence bolts of lightning blazed forth.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:14
verses.text: The LORD thundered from heaven; the voice of the Most High resounded.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:15
verses.text: He shot arrows and scattered the enemies, bolts of lightning and routed them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:16
verses.text: The valleys of the sea were exposed and the foundations of the earth laid bare at the rebuke of the LORD, at the blast of breath from his nostrils.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:17
verses.text: "He reached down from on high and took hold of me; he drew me out of deep waters.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:18
verses.text: He rescued me from my powerful enemy, from my foes, who were too strong for me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:19
verses.text: They confronted me in the day of my disaster, but the LORD was my support.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:20
verses.text: He brought me out into a spacious place; he rescued me because he delighted in me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:21
verses.text: "The LORD has dealt with me according to my righteousness; according to the cleanness of my hands he has rewarded me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:22
verses.text: For I have kept the ways of the LORD; I have not done evil by turning from my God.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:23
verses.text: All his laws are before me; I have not turned away from his decrees.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:24
verses.text: I have been blameless before him and have kept myself from sin.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:25
verses.text: The LORD has rewarded me according to my righteousness, according to my cleanness in his sight.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:26
verses.text: "To the faithful you show yourself faithful, to the blameless you show yourself blameless,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:27
verses.text: to the pure you show yourself pure, but to the crooked you show yourself shrewd.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:28
verses.text: You save the humble, but your eyes are on the haughty to bring them low.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:29
verses.text: You are my lamp, O LORD; the LORD turns my darkness into light.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:30
verses.text: With your help I can advance against a troop; with my God I can scale a wall.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:31
verses.text: "As for God, his way is perfect; the word of the LORD is flawless. He is a shield for all who take refuge in him.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:32
verses.text: For who is God besides the LORD? And who is the Rock except our God?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:33
verses.text: It is God who arms me with strength and makes my way perfect.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:34
verses.text: He makes my feet like the feet of a deer; he enables me to stand on the heights.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:35
verses.text: He trains my hands for battle; my arms can bend a bow of bronze.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:36
verses.text: You give me your shield of victory; you stoop down to make me great.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:37
verses.text: You broaden the path beneath me, so that my ankles do not turn.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:38
verses.text: "I pursued my enemies and crushed them; I did not turn back till they were destroyed.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:39
verses.text: I crushed them completely, and they could not rise; they fell beneath my feet.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:40
verses.text: You armed me with strength for battle; you made my adversaries bow at my feet.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:41
verses.text: You made my enemies turn their backs in flight, and I destroyed my foes.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:42
verses.text: They cried for help, but there was no one to save them- to the LORD, but he did not answer.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:43
verses.text: I beat them as fine as the dust of the earth; I pounded and trampled them like mud in the streets.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:44
verses.text: "You have delivered me from the attacks of my people; you have preserved me as the head of nations. People I did not know are subject to me,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:45
verses.text: and foreigners come cringing to me; as soon as they hear me, they obey me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:46
verses.text: They all lose heart; they come trembling from their strongholds.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:47
verses.text: "The LORD lives! Praise be to my Rock! Exalted be God, the Rock, my Savior!

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:48
verses.text: He is the God who avenges me, who puts the nations under me,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:49
verses.text: who sets me free from my enemies. You exalted me above my foes; from violent men you rescued me.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:50
verses.text: Therefore I will praise you, O LORD, among the nations; I will sing praises to your name.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 22:51
verses.text: He gives his king great victories; he shows unfailing kindness to his anointed, to David and his descendants forever."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:1
verses.text: These are the last words of David: "The oracle of David son of Jesse, the oracle of the man exalted by the Most High, the man anointed by the God of Jacob, Israel's singer of songs:

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:2
verses.text: "The Spirit of the LORD spoke through me; his word was on my tongue.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:3
verses.text: The God of Israel spoke, the Rock of Israel said to me: 'When one rules over men in righteousness, when he rules in the fear of God,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:4
verses.text: he is like the light of morning at sunrise on a cloudless morning, like the brightness after rain that brings the grass from the earth.'

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:5
verses.text: "Is not my house right with God? Has he not made with me an everlasting covenant, arranged and secured in every part? Will he not bring to fruition my salvation and grant me my every desire?

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:6
verses.text: But evil men are all to be cast aside like thorns, which are not gathered with the hand.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:7
verses.text: Whoever touches thorns uses a tool of iron or the shaft of a spear; they are burned up where they lie."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:8
verses.text: These are the names of David's mighty men: Josheb-Basshebeth, a Tahkemonite, was chief of the Three; he raised his spear against eight hundred men, whom he killed in one encounter.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:9
verses.text: Next to him was Eleazar son of Dodai the Ahohite. As one of the three mighty men, he was with David when they taunted the Philistines gathered at Pas Dammim for battle. Then the men of Israel retreated,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:10
verses.text: but he stood his ground and struck down the Philistines till his hand grew tired and froze to the sword. The LORD brought about a great victory that day. The troops returned to Eleazar, but only to strip the dead.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:11
verses.text: Next to him was Shammah son of Agee the Hararite. When the Philistines banded together at a place where there was a field full of lentils, Israel's troops fled from them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:12
verses.text: But Shammah took his stand in the middle of the field. He defended it and struck the Philistines down, and the LORD brought about a great victory.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:13
verses.text: During harvest time, three of the thirty chief men came down to David at the cave of Adullam, while a band of Philistines was encamped in the Valley of Rephaim.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:14
verses.text: At that time David was in the stronghold, and the Philistine garrison was at Bethlehem.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:15
verses.text: David longed for water and said, "Oh, that someone would get me a drink of water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem!"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:16
verses.text: So the three mighty men broke through the Philistine lines, drew water from the well near the gate of Bethlehem and carried it back to David. But he refused to drink it; instead, he poured it out before the LORD.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:17
verses.text: "Far be it from me, O LORD, to do this!" he said. "Is it not the blood of men who went at the risk of their lives?" And David would not drink it. Such were the exploits of the three mighty men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:18
verses.text: Abishai the brother of Joab son of Zeruiah was chief of the Three. He raised his spear against three hundred men, whom he killed, and so he became as famous as the Three.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:19
verses.text: Was he not held in greater honor than the Three? He became their commander, even though he was not included among them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:20
verses.text: Benaiah son of Jehoiada was a valiant fighter from Kabzeel, who performed great exploits. He struck down two of Moab's best men. He also went down into a pit on a snowy day and killed a lion.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:21
verses.text: And he struck down a huge Egyptian. Although the Egyptian had a spear in his hand, Benaiah went against him with a club. He snatched the spear from the Egyptian's hand and killed him with his own spear.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:22
verses.text: Such were the exploits of Benaiah son of Jehoiada; he too was as famous as the three mighty men.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:23
verses.text: He was held in greater honor than any of the Thirty, but he was not included among the Three. And David put him in charge of his bodyguard.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:24
verses.text: Among the Thirty were: Asahel the brother of Joab, Elhanan son of Dodo from Bethlehem,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:25
verses.text: Shammah the Harodite, Elika the Harodite,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:26
verses.text: Helez the Paltite, Ira son of Ikkesh from Tekoa,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:27
verses.text: Abiezer from Anathoth, Mebunnai the Hushathite,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:28
verses.text: Zalmon the Ahohite, Maharai the Netophathite,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:29
verses.text: Heled son of Baanah the Netophathite, Ithai son of Ribai from Gibeah in Benjamin,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:30
verses.text: Benaiah the Pirathonite, Hiddai from the ravines of Gaash,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:31
verses.text: Abi-Albon the Arbathite, Azmaveth the Barhumite,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:32
verses.text: Eliahba the Shaalbonite, the sons of Jashen, Jonathan

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:33
verses.text: son of Shammah the Hararite, Ahiam son of Sharar the Hararite,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:34
verses.text: Eliphelet son of Ahasbai the Maacathite, Eliam son of Ahithophel the Gilonite,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:35
verses.text: Hezro the Carmelite, Paarai the Arbite,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:36
verses.text: Igal son of Nathan from Zobah, the son of Hagri,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:37
verses.text: Zelek the Ammonite, Naharai the Beerothite, the armor-bearer of Joab son of Zeruiah,

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:38
verses.text: Ira the Ithrite, Gareb the Ithrite

verses.name: 2 Samuel 23:39
verses.text: and Uriah the Hittite. There were thirty-seven in all.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:1
verses.text: Again the anger of the LORD burned against Israel, and he incited David against them, saying, "Go and take a census of Israel and Judah."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:2
verses.text: So the king said to Joab and the army commanders with him, "Go throughout the tribes of Israel from Dan to Beersheba and enroll the fighting men, so that I may know how many there are."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:3
verses.text: But Joab replied to the king, "May the LORD your God multiply the troops a hundred times over, and may the eyes of my lord the king see it. But why does my lord the king want to do such a thing?"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:4
verses.text: The king's word, however, overruled Joab and the army commanders; so they left the presence of the king to enroll the fighting men of Israel.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:5
verses.text: After crossing the Jordan, they camped near Aroer, south of the town in the gorge, and then went through Gad and on to Jazer.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:6
verses.text: They went to Gilead and the region of Tahtim Hodshi, and on to Dan Jaan and around toward Sidon.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:7
verses.text: Then they went toward the fortress of Tyre and all the towns of the Hivites and Canaanites. Finally, they went on to Beersheba in the Negev of Judah.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:8
verses.text: After they had gone through the entire land, they came back to Jerusalem at the end of nine months and twenty days.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:9
verses.text: Joab reported the number of the fighting men to the king: In Israel there were eight hundred thousand able-bodied men who could handle a sword, and in Judah five hundred thousand.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:10
verses.text: David was conscience-stricken after he had counted the fighting men, and he said to the LORD, "I have sinned greatly in what I have done. Now, O LORD, I beg you, take away the guilt of your servant. I have done a very foolish thing."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:11
verses.text: Before David got up the next morning, the word of the LORD had come to Gad the prophet, David's seer:

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:12
verses.text: "Go and tell David, 'This is what the LORD says: I am giving you three options. Choose one of them for me to carry out against you.'"

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:13
verses.text: So Gad went to David and said to him, "Shall there come upon you three years of famine in your land? Or three months of fleeing from your enemies while they pursue you? Or three days of plague in your land? Now then, think it over and decide how I should answer the one who sent me."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:14
verses.text: David said to Gad, "I am in deep distress. Let us fall into the hands of the LORD, for his mercy is great; but do not let me fall into the hands of men."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:15
verses.text: So the LORD sent a plague on Israel from that morning until the end of the time designated, and seventy thousand of the people from Dan to Beersheba died.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:16
verses.text: When the angel stretched out his hand to destroy Jerusalem, the LORD was grieved because of the calamity and said to the angel who was afflicting the people, "Enough! Withdraw your hand." The angel of the LORD was then at the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:17
verses.text: When David saw the angel who was striking down the people, he said to the LORD, "I am the one who has sinned and done wrong. These are but sheep. What have they done? Let your hand fall upon me and my family."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:18
verses.text: On that day Gad went to David and said to him, "Go up and build an altar to the LORD on the threshing floor of Araunah the Jebusite."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:19
verses.text: So David went up, as the LORD had commanded through Gad.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:20
verses.text: When Araunah looked and saw the king and his men coming toward him, he went out and bowed down before the king with his face to the ground.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:21
verses.text: Araunah said, "Why has my lord the king come to his servant?To buy your threshing floor," David answered, "so I can build an altar to the LORD, that the plague on the people may be stopped."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:22
verses.text: Araunah said to David, "Let my lord the king take whatever pleases him and offer it up. Here are oxen for the burnt offering, and here are threshing sledges and ox yokes for the wood.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:23
verses.text: O king, Araunah gives all this to the king." Araunah also said to him, "May the LORD your God accept you."

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:24
verses.text: But the king replied to Araunah, "No, I insist on paying you for it. I will not sacrifice to the LORD my God burnt offerings that cost me nothing." So David bought the threshing floor and the oxen and paid fifty shekels of silver for them.

verses.name: 2 Samuel 24:25
verses.text: David built an altar to the LORD there and sacrificed burnt offerings and fellowship offerings. Then the LORD answered prayer in behalf of the land, and the plague on Israel was stopped.
